intro: Drimia obstii, commonly known as the Natal bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves and has a bulbous root system that helps it store water. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
